results.title: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture camera use; loading, running off leader and how to avoid fogging; how to keep the camera steady and use of a tripod; panning and common faults to avoid; the use of the zoom and the need for restraint; placing of the camera and avoidance of the jump cut; pitfalls of reverse action and parallax.
results.title_for_label: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera

results.title: Physical fitness (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Animation and the singing of lighthearted lyrics contrasts the lack of physical activity since machinery has become such a large part of modern life, against the amount of physical activity that was necessary before the event of such machinery. “We have a different style. But we don’t get enough exercise” are part of the lyrics which introduce this program. However, the video ends on a positive and hopeful note, as mankind is re-educated in the improvements possible to ensure health, happiness and quality of life by increasing daily physical activities.

results.title: Getting physically fit
results.creator_credit: Richard Miner and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Shows how to actually achieve physical fitness through a carefully planned program. Students learn the importance of warming-up, stretching and cooling-down exercise and see how results can be attained by maintaining a regular program that gradually increases in frequency or duration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Miner and Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: Community under siege
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Davies, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In her role as a co-ordinator of the community centre, Suzanne Davies recounts the devastation that the Gippsland bushfires caused her community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Editing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to editing the newly processed film with examples of the right and wrong way. First extract and discard unwanted material and adjust the general order, then edit to preserve continuity of movement by cutting an action matching action or the use of cut aways; continuity with static subjects and editing to create contrast and impact; importance of tempo.

results.title: My nightmare has just begun
results.creator_credit: Linda Lord, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Lord recounts the day the Gippsland bushfires came to her home. Despite undergoing fire training and preparation, when the fire front approached, there was no time to think. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: D-Day
results.creator_credit: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Darryl Jordan and his partner prepare their home for the encroaching bushfires. The wait for D-day is all-consuming for this family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
